result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler Joseph Gerszewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any other sentence; with credit for 5 days time served

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample. Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges, fees, and assessments over period of probation. Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.
- Seek/maintain full-time employment or verify school enrollment.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF PROBATION, INCLUDING PAYMENT OF ALL COSTS, COURT FINDS EXPUNGEMENT APPROPRIATE

- Cooperate with the Department and any treatment deemed appropriate.
- Take all prescribed medications.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler Joseph Gerszewski

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyler Joseph Gerszewski in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Jack T Eichorst for Erin Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Original Amended Information received and e-filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt, waives reading, and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

COUNTS 1 & 2:  
 Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
Court advised defendant if they are not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, they could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  

COUNT 1:
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence with credit for 5 days days time served.  STAYED and placed on probation for 18 months

COUNT 2:
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence with credit for 5 days days time served.  STAYED and placed on probation for 18 months

Counts 1 and 2 Terms of Probation:
-Cooperate with the Department and any treatment deemed appropriate
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Seek / Maintain full time employment or verify school enrollment
-Take all prescribed medications
-Provide DNA sample

The Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges, fees, and assessments over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant
************************
Upon successful completion of probation, including payment of all costs, court finds expungement appropriate.  kmw

Defendant Tyler Joseph Gerszewski in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Tyler Joseph Gerszewski appeared by video means with Attorney.  Br 34 will accept for global resolution, 22CF1077.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Tyler Joseph Gerszewski not in court, in custody, CJF; appearance waived.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant in custody on new summary charges.  Also, 22cf1077 awaiting preliminary hearing.  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyler Joseph Gerszewski in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tyler Joseph Gerszewski appeared by video means.
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense received discovery. Case can possibly resolve globally with case 22CF1077. Case adjourned for a status conference.  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am by zoom.

Defendant Tyler Joseph Gerszewski in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Franklin Officer A. German. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No VIOLENT Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with L.G.; D.P.

Atty Sylvan Jaspen now appears for the defendant after a brief breakout session to discuss defendant's competency.
Defendant's mom, Lindsey Gerszewski appears by Zoom.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Tyler Joseph Gerszewski in court with Student Intern Grace Hagerman under the supervision of Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Tyler Joseph Gerszewski in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tyler Joseph Gerszewski appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
